sanskrit_verse:
गुरुपत्नी तु युवतिर्नाभिवाद्यैह पादयोः ।
पूर्णविंशतिवर्षेण गुणदोषौ विजानता ॥ २.२१२॥
transliteration:
gurupatnī tu yuvatir nābhivādyaih pādayoḥ |
pūrṇaviṃśativarṣeṇa guṇadoṣau vijānatā || 2.212||
sph_interpretive_translation: A young woman who is the wife of one's guru must not be saluted by touching her feet; she who knows both merit and demerit fully by the age of twenty.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through spiritual lineage, not marital status
Capacity-based responsibility arises with knowledge of dharma
Respect is contextually determined by ontological role
Restoration occurs through alignment with one’s true capacity
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.age >= 20 AND agent.knowledge.dharma THEN assign full dharmic capacity
IF relationship.guru_spouse EXISTS THEN DO NOT invoke foot-salutation protocol
IF violation.respect_protocol_detected THEN initiate consciousness-realignment process
IF agent.dharmic_knowledge.deficient THEN trigger capacity-restoration sequence
IF societal_role ≠ ontological_role THEN override conventional honorifics
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving spiritual hierarchies, the Supreme Court must recognize that relational respect is derivative of ontological function, not personal status. Legal thresholds for dharmic agency commence at twenty years when accompanied by demonstrated discernment between virtue and vice.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that dharma-consciousness manifests fully upon reaching twenty years with clear discriminative awareness. Thus, any misalignment in ceremonial conduct is addressed through completion rather than correction, ensuring sequential unfolding (anupūrvaśaḥ) aligns with inherent capacity realization.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate guided reflection sessions to restore understanding of relational dharma
Assign mentorship roles to reinforce proper contextual conduct
Implement ritual literacy programs to clarify symbolic boundaries
Engage corrective dialogue to reaffirm ontological roles without shame
Reinforce community integration through service aligned with one’s evolved capacity
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores balance through consciousness alignment, upholds capacity-based responsibility, and affirms that justice serves only restoration—not punishment. Reality itself adjudicates through awakened awareness.
